lines.content: * Represents a task that is of type "deadline" and extends from Task class.
* Returns a Deadline task object that stores information about the task: task description,
* Whenever due time not given, set the time to be empty
* @param dueDate Due date for the task.
* @param dueTime Due time for the task.
public Deadline(String taskInfo, String dueDate, String dueTime) {
* Returns a string on the information about the Deadline task that is to be added to the ongoing taskList.
* @return String message of the Deadline task description and status.
* Returns a string on the information about the Deadline task that is to be saved to the file allocated by Storage.
* @return String message of the Deadline task description and status.
* Represents the Duke application, capable of storing 3 types of Tasks ("ToDos", "Deadline" & "Event")
* in the hard disk for users to refer to at any point of time.
* Acts as a form of reminder / tracker and supports the following functions:
* add, remove, mark, unmark and display list.
* Returns a Duke object that requires the filePath and folderPath to initialize the application,
* retrieving tasks stored in the hard disk.
* @param filePath  Relative path to locate the file with the stored tasks.
* @param folderPath Relative path to locate the directory storing the file.
* Executes the Duke application, requires user input to perform necessary actions and stops the Duke application
* when user inputs the given command to end.
* Functions currently supported by Duke: add Task, remove Task, mark Task, unmark Task, delete Task, list, bye.
* This is the main method that creates the Duke object and boots the application up via run() method.
* @param args Input given by users via the CLI
public static void main(String[] args) throws IOException {
* Represents a task that is of type "event" and extends from Task class.
* Returns an Event task object that stores information about the task: task description, start date,
* start time, end date and endTime.
* Whenever start time and end time not given, set them to be empty.
* @param stringStartDate Date that the Event begins.
* @param stringEndDate Date that the Event ends.
* @param stringStartTime Start time of the Event.
* @param stringEndTime End time of the Event.
public Event(String taskInfo, String stringStartDate, String stringEndDate,
* Returns a string on the information about the Event task that is to be added to the ongoing taskList.

* Returns a string on the information about the Event task that is to be saved to the file allocated by Storage.

* Represents a Parser that takes in user input and process it into the necessary format for Duke application
* Returns an ArrayList of String type that contains the processed command information,
* derived from the user input via the CLI.
* This method aids in processing user input.
* @param taskInfo Command information obtained from user's input via the CLI.
* @return ArrayList of String type, containing processed command information.
* @throws IncorrectNoOfArgumentException When there is insufficient arguments provided by the user.
protected static ArrayList<String> parse(String taskInfo) throws IncorrectNoOfArgumentException {
ArrayList<String> parseInfoList = new ArrayList<>(); // stores in the format "command" followed by "args"
boolean isFnAvailable = false; // indicates whether user is calling a supported function provided by Duke
String tempCmd; // stores function call by user (eg todos, mark, etc)
if (tempTaskInfo.length != 1) { // retrieving info from file and processing it
} else { // adding new task that is not from file and processing it
try { // determine function called by the user has required arguments and does not have blank spaces
parseInfoList.add(tempCmd); // save function call (command) into parseInfo
switch (tempCmd) { // retrieving arguments required by the commands
case "deadline": // format: done (optional) | deadline | taskInfo | date | time
try { // checking the element "cccc" in ".../by cccc"
case "event": // format: done (optional) | event | taskInfo | startDate | startTime | endDate | endTime
try { // checking the element "bbbb" in ".../from bbbb /to aaaa"
if (startDateTime.length > 2) { // check if given a startDate
try { // checking the element "aaaa" in ".../to aaaa"
if (endDateTime.length > 1) { // check if given a endDate
default: // throw an error as the user is trying to call a function that does not exist

* Represents a task (that can be of type "event", "todos" and "deadline")
* Note: Abstract class that needs to be implemented
* Returns a Task object that stores information about the task description.
* Returns a string that indicates the Task has been completed.
* @return String message that indicates the completion of a Task.
return "     Nice! I've marked this task as done:\n       " + this.getTaskInfoStatus();
* Returns a string that indicates the Task yet to complete.
* @return String message that indicates the Task is yet to complete.
return "     Alright, I've marked this task as not done yet:\n       " + this.getTaskInfoStatus();
* Returns a string on the information about the Task that is to be added to the ongoing taskList.

* Returns a string on the information about the Task that is to be saved to the file allocated by Storage.

* Represents a list used for storing all task information on Duke.
* Represents a Central Processing Unit (CPU) as well to perform the various commands by user.
* Returns a TaskList object that stores all tasks in an ArrayList of type Task
* @param fileTasks ArrayList of String type that contains all task information stored in the file that needs to
*                  be added into Duke's TaskList upon boot up.
* Returns a string message generated by the creation of the new task.
* This method helps to create a new task and add its information into the hard disk.
* @param parsedInfoList ArrayList of String type that contains parsed information about the task description and
* @param file Duke's Storage object to allow file access.
* @return String message of the new task's description and status.
public String addTask(ArrayList<String> parsedInfoList, Storage file) { // returns message to be printed to user
.append("    Got it. I've added this task to the list:\n")

this.message = "An unexpected error has occurred: " + e.getMessage();

* Represents the user interface (UI) that deals with the user inputs and outputs the corresponding texts and messages
* Returns a UI object that reads inputs from user using BufferedReader and outputs messages from the system to
* the user with the means of StringBuilder and PrintWriter.
* Displays the welcome message generated by Duke system upon boot up.
.append("    What can I do for you?\n")
pw.flush(); // Flush the message out and print to user
sb.setLength(0); // Clear string stored in StringBuilder
* Displays the farewell message generated by Duke system during termination.
.append("    Bye. Hope to see you again soon!\n")
* Displays the attached corresponding message attached as this method's argument to user.
* @param message Message generated by Duke system that needs to be printed out to the user.
* Displays an error message to user, informing him/her that the date/time given were of the wrong format and
* informs them of the correct format.
sb.append("Please enter your date & time in the format: YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM \n");
sb.append("Please also ensure they are valid values!\n");
* Displays the error message generated by the input Exception.
* @param e Exception that was generated by Duke system.
* Returns a string that corresponds to the user input on the CLI.
* @return A string the corresponds to the user input on the CLI.
* Represents the Exception class unique and created for Duke to handle certain unexpected and unwanted situations.
* This method helps to check if a certain command to run has the necessary arguments supplied to it.
* This method is also able to prompt for a secondary check for cases where blank spaces or blank texts
* @param hasToEvaluate Boolean value that indicates whether there's a need for secondary check.
* @param command String message of the command / action input by users via CLI.
* @param testPortion String array of the affected portion of the command that needs to be checked.
* @throws IncorrectNoOfArgumentException When arguments supplied are insufficient.
public static void validate(boolean hasToEvaluate, String command,
.append("      OOPS!!! You have provided incorrect number of arguments for the command '")
